title: Electrical
content:
THROTTLE POSITION .................... INCREASE IN TPS VOLTAGE

    10° Closed Throttle* .................... 0 volts

    20° .................... .38 volts

    30° .................... .75 volts

    45° Half Throttle .................... 1.31 volts

    58° .................... 1.80 volts**

    75° .................... 2.43 volts***

    90° Wide Open Throttle .................... 3.00 volts

 
*   At idle throttle blade is 10° open. When throttle is opened from idle to wide open throttle, the blade has traveled only 80°.

**  The Powertrain Control Module (PCM) considers an increase of 1.80 volts or more wide open throttle.

*** The PCM will shut off fuel injection if Throttle Position Sensor (TPS) voltage is 2.43 V above minimum.
